result.execSummary:
Gregory A Lewis was extradited to another county, state or jurisdiction. Extradition means Gregory A Lewis was accused or convicted of an offense in another county, state or jurisdiction and was taken there to face their charge(s) or conviction.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Gregory A Lewis

records.addlTxt: Signed by WCSO (Winnebago-Rockford, IL) who picked up on 7/25/22
Review hearing on August 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Warrant for Commitment, signed by Commissioner David Herring on July 21, 2022.
Signed by all parties in Court and Commissioner David Herring on July 21, 2022.

01:11 PM Defendant Gregory A Lewis in court, in custody, with attorney Amanda Marie Nimmer.  District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and accompanying affidavit and waives reading of complaint and affidavit.  Court notes a defect within the documents filed and there is not a signed arrest warrant from the State of Illinois.  The State requests to pass this case to look into this matter further.  
Court takes recess at 1:15 pm.  
Case recalled at 2:48 pm.  
Defendant Gregory A Lewis in court, in custody, with attorney Amanda Marie Nimmer.  Andrea Will appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The Court is now in receipt of the signed warrant for arrest.  Court Conducts Waiver of Extradition Colloquy with the defendant.  Defendant waives his right to extradition.  Court accepts the waiver of extradition.  Parties and the court sign the waiver of extradition.  Court Commissioner signed the Order for Commitment. 

The State gives its bail recommendation requesting bail be revoked and the defendant be held until he is picked up.  
The Defense gives its bail recommendation.  
The Court will not set bail and the defendant shall be held in custody until he is picked up by the State of IL.  
THE COURT REMANDS THE DEFENDANT TO THE CUSTODY OF THE WAUKESHA COUNTY JAIL.
State of Illinois is to be notified ASAP that the defendant is available for pick up.  Review hearing scheduled for August 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Warrant of Arrest from Winnebago County, IL
Affidavit and State of Illinois Arrest Warrant
